intro: Draba scandinavica, commonly known as the Scandinavian rockcress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia, including Scandinavia, where it thrives in rocky and gravelly habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–15 cm, with basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers from April to June, which attract various pollinators. Draba scandinavica is characterized by its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, cold environments.
